author: ajsutton
content: Not sure if we have people building eth2 block explorer type products here, but one thing that would be really awesome is a deposit tracker.  The time between sending a deposit transaction and the validator actually being active is really scary.  It would be great to have something that tracks the very tip of ETH1 (not trailing 1024 blocks behind like most nodes do) that tracks the whole process from getting into an eth1 block, being follow distance behind, the beacon chain eth1 data progressing far enough to make it available for inclusion, actually being included in an eth2 block, entering activation queue and finally being active.

author: ajsutton
content: I think some clients can give insight into part of that but as far as I know none track from the very tip of the eth1 chain and it's those first few hours of waiting that are the most nervous.

author: prestonvanloon
content: I am pretty sure etherscan does this

author: prestonvanloon
content: Prysm will inform the user that the deposit has been seen, but not eligible for inclusion yet
